Recipe.title: Wontons
Recipe.Source: From the Kitchen of Gramma Mitzi, Di's Mom
Recipe.Description: When Di looks back and remembers peaceful times at home, she remembers her mom making Wonton Soup. We came up with this recipe to be able to make Wonton Soup. Then we used leftovers to make Fried Wontons.

section.instruction: In a bowl combine all of the ingredients, except for the Wrappers, and mix well.
Get out a cup or small bowl and fill with about 1 Cup Water.

Form the Wontons using one of the following styles: Place 1 skin flat on the table and place 1 teaspoon of the filler in the middle. Dip a finger in the Water and moisten each edge of the Wrapper. Fold one corner of the Wrapper to the corner opposite of it, so that you will get a triangle. Press down the edges, taking care to press all of the air out before the seal is complete. Arrange the Wonton so that the longest edge is toward you. Moisten the top ½" surface of the right corner and the bottom ½" surface of the left corner. Place index finger, fingernail down, halfway between right and left corners. Fold the left corner up onto your finger, then the right corner on top of the left corner. Pinch the two corners together. Gently set aside.
Place 1 skin flat on the table and place 1 teaspoon of the filler in the middle. Dip a finger in the Water and moisten each edge of the Wrapper. Fold all 4 points of the wonton skin up to the center. Pinch each edge from the center point to the outside edge, taking care to press all air out before the seal is complete. Gently set aside.

Notes.note: You can buy Wonton Wrappers at most grocery stores. A 14-oz. package contains about 44 skins.

Modifications.modification:
Do NOT use Grated Ginger if Di is eating with you!
Di doesn't like Ginger, so her mom set it in a bowl on the table and it was used as a condiment.
